item.title: Input Function
item.description: The Input function is used to take input from the user. user = input("Please enter your name: ") print(50 * "=") print(f"Hello {user}, Good Morning!") first_num = input("Enter a number to multiply: ") second_num = input("Enter a second number to multiply: ") result = int(first_num) * int(second_num) print(f"{first_num}* {second_num}= {result}") Because Python runs from top down, it will not execute the next line of code until I typed the input
